Loc.Value: Select a module to clone to:

Note: The optimal image size is 1250x1500px. Other sizes with similar aspect ratio can be used too. Using Image with different aspect ratio will result in the image being distorted.

To add new images to this list, place them in \ExternalAssets\AdventureGraphics, located in your game folder.

Use .png or .jpg formats only!
Alchemy is the knowledge how to turn Gold to Mana or vice versa. Wizards with Alchemy Trait are able to convert with 1:1 ratio, those without it will only yield half of the selected substance.

Power comes from your Fortress, Spellbooks, magic nodes, religious town buildings, and some races' townsfolk. It is used to generate Mana, research spells and increase the Casting Skill.\n\nYou can adjust how your Power is assigned for each purpose by clicking on the vials.
Used to generate Mana, research spells and increase Casting Skill.

Directly affects the speed of learning new spells. Can be increased by assigning more Power to the green vial, constructing building such as Library, Sages' Guild, University and Wizards' Guild or hiring heroes with the Sage ability.
Mana points available for spellcasting. Can be increased by assigning Power points to Mana (yellow vial).

Farmers feed your population.
-1 Food {ICON:FoodIcon} is needed to sustain each citizen.
Each 2 surplus Food is turned into 1 Gold {ICON:GoldIcon} at the end of turn.
Every farmer also adds 0.5 production {ICON:ProductionIcon}.

-Note: Only farmers producing surplus Food can become workers.
-Food deficit in a city will cause {COLOR:#42C100}starvation {END_COLOR} and decrease its population.
You cannot lower the number of farmers below the minimum that is necessary to support the town's population.
Workers' job is to provide production points, which the town uses to construct buildings and recruit units.\n\n-Note: Only farmers producing surplus Food can become workers.

Rebels generate no Food, Gold or Production in the town but still consume food. As unrest increases, more Rebels will surface.\n\nRebels can be reduced by constructing religious buildings, unrest reduction spells or a garrison of non-fantastic units at -1 Rebel reduction per 2 units.
Master, your towns do not produce enough Food to sustain all your units. Perhaps you can reassign workers to produce more Food?\n\nIf you continue, some units will abandon you!
Master, your towns do not produce enough Mana to sustain all your units. Perhaps you can reassign your Power to increase Mana production?\n\nIf you continue, some units will abandon you!
Select a Spell Ward to cast
Only four powers may be enchanted into an item!

Represents the number of attack rolls each figure performs during a single melee attack action.

{ICON:MeleeIconAdded} represents a bonus due to spells or special abilities.

 {ICON:MeleeIconMissing} represents a minus.
Represents the number of attack rolls each figure performs during a single melee attack action.

Represents the number of attack rolls each figure performs during a single ranged attack action.

{ICON:RangedIconAdded} represents a bonus due to spells or special abilities.

{ICON:RangedIconMissing} represents a minus.
Represents the number of attack rolls each figure performs during a single ranged attack action.

Represents the number of defence rolls each figure performs during a single defence action. Defence rolls are performed to reduce damage from melee and ranged attacks as well as some offensive spells.

{ICON:ArmourIconAdded} represents a bonus due to spells or special abilities.

 {ICON:ArmourIconMissing} represents a minus.

Represents the number of defence rolls each figure performs during a single defence action. Defence rolls are performed to reduce damage from melee and ranged attacks as well as some offensive spells.

Represents the ability to withstand ill effects of enemy attacks and spells. Each point increases the chance to resist such effects by 10%.

{ICON:ResistanceIconAdded} represents a bonus due to spells or special abilities.

 {ICON:ResistanceIconMissing} represents a minus.
Represents the ability to withstand ill effects of enemy attacks and spells. Each point increases the chance to resist such effects by 10%.

Represents the number of individual characters or entities that form the unit. Any missing figures will reduce the combat effectiveness of the unit.

{ICON:FigureIconMissing} represents missing figures.

Missing figures will gradually recover between overland turns.
Represents the number of individual characters or entities that form the unit. Any missing figures will reduce the combat effectiveness of the unit.

Represents the number of hits each figure can take before being killed or destroyed. Damage is assigned to the top figure.

{ICON:HitIconAdded} represents a bonus due to spells or special abilities - all figures have their Hit Points increased.

{ICON:HitIconMissing} represents a point of damage taken by the top figure.

Most units recover Hit Points gradually between overland turns or they can be healed using spells or other effects.
Represents the number of hits each figure can take before being killed or destroyed.
Indicates how many shots can be fired by the unit (this also applies to units with ranged magical attacks).\nOnce the Ammunition is depleted, the unit can only perform melee attacks.
The current Mana, note that your Casting Skill{ICON:CastingSkillIcon} may limit how much you may use in combat.

The number of movement points that can be spent on travel through overland map tiles each turn but also the number of action points during battle.

{ICON:MovementWalkingIcon} Ground Movement

{ICON:MovementSwimmingIcon} Water Movement 

{ICON:MovementFlyingIcon} Air Movement
The number of movement points that can be spent on travel through overland map tiles each turn but also the number of action points during battle.
Indicates the maintenance cost of the unit in Gold {ICON:GoldIcon}, Food {ICON:FoodIcon} and/or Mana {ICON:ManaIcon} each turn. If the cost cannot be paid, the unit will be disbanded.
Shows the percentage health of the entire unit.

Indicates the maximum cost of spells that can be cast by you during this combat. It also influences how much maximum Mana{ICON:ManaIcon} you may add to a spells' power (for spells that can be boosted).

On the overland map, Casting Skill indicates how much maximum Mana can be spent for spellcasting each turn.\n\nIn combat, it determines the maximum casting cost and Mana pool you may use during an entire battle.

Each new point of Casting Skill costs your current Casting Skill x2.

Once the progress bar fills up, you will gain +1 Casting Skill.

To improve your Casting Skill, invest Power points into Casting Skill improvement (red vial).
A multiplier that affects the Mana cost of your spells in battle. The farther away the combat is from the Wizard fortress, the greater the multiplier.
A merchant arrives and offers a magic {0} for sale. The price is only {1} Gold pieces.
Shows your current Gold reserve and income per turn. If Gold reserve falls below 0, units will be disbanded to reduce expenditure.
Shows your current Mana reserve and income per turn. If Mana reserve falls below 0, units will be disbanded to reduce expenditure.
Needed to sustain your citizens and normal units.
Used to feed your armies. If Food supply falls below 0, units will be disbanded. Excess is not stockpiled - each 2 surplus Food is turned into 1 Gold at the end of turn.

Fame is your reputation. Heroes are more likely to join famous Wizards and merchants are more likely to offer artefacts to them. Fame also decreases troop maintenance cost by 1 Gold for each point of Fame.
Used for unit upkeep, purchasing new units or buildings, hiring heroes. Fame reduces unit upkeep cost.
Production points are used to construct buildings and train units. The more production points your citizens produce, the quicker construction will progress.
Used to construct buildings and train units.
This is where your Summoning Circle is located, and where summoned units will appear.\n\nThe location of your Summoning Circle can be changed by casting the Summoning Circle spell.
Shows the spell that is currently being cast. Depending on your Casting Skill and Mana cost of the chosen spell, casting may take more than 1 turn. You will be notified when the spell is ready.
Shows your current research focus. Research speed depends directly on Research Points, which are generated by assigning Power points to Research (green vial).
Select a building from the left column or a unit from the right column to view details.

The number of people inhabiting this city and it's growth per turn.

Each 1000 can be assigned a job of a farmer or a worker on the Citizens panel.

Max Population shown is the starting max and can be modified by various factors, like spells or buildings.

The percentage of unrest in this city, it takes into account global unrest, as well as any other modifications. Unrest generates Rebels.\n\nUnrest is modified by the tax rate, racial tensions (based on the location of your Fortress), persistent enchantments and garrisoned units.

The number of citizens is based on population (1 for each 1000). Citizens by default are farmers that farm Food {ICON:FoodIcon} but can be assigned a job of a worker to increase production {ICON:ProductionIcon}. Unrest may also cause citizens to become rebels who refuse to work and do not produce anything.
Shows the percentage of townsfolk unhappy with the current tax rate (this is added to the individual town's unrest calculations).
To send this item to the chosen hero, you need to use your magic powers.\nThe cost is:
You do not have enough Mana!
To counter this spell, you must pay as much mana as the casting wizard already has invested into it.
Do you want to save your game?
Master, I have sad news! Some units deserted from your army because of Gold, Food or Mana shortages!
You need to use all your picks to proceed
You can not select both Life and Death magic
You need to select more spells for this realm.
Special abilities of the wizard. New traits can be acquired from clearing out very difficult locations.\n\nThe number of traits is limited to 6.
Myrran Races can only be selected if the Wizard has the Myrran trait.
Familiar says: "Master, if you let me command your troops, these are the outcomes I predict:"
Do you want to take command personally, leave it to your familiar or perhaps not engage at all?
Allow your familiar to use Mana {ICON:ManaIcon} to increase your chance of victory.
This unit is equipped with a normal weapon that provides no additional bonuses.
This unit has an enchanted weapon from a spell or their special ability.
Skills are special abilities that give units a specific advantage.
Enchantments are positive or negative effects applied with magical spells. Not all enchantments can be dispelled!
You are leaving the editor. Do you wish to save your changes or discard them?
Represents the success chance of a single melee attack roll.
Represents the success chance of a single ranged attack roll.
Represents the success chance of a single defence roll to prevent a single point of damage from an incoming conventional attack.
Represents the cumulative chance to resist ill effects of enemy attacks and spells.

The location you have chosen for your new town is not valid.

- The minimum distance between towns has to be {0} tiles, and

- Towns cannot be built on water tiles.

You are running out of Gold. To keep your balance above 0, you may need to increase taxes, reassign workers and/or sell buildings and units.\n\nIf you continue, you will be forced to sell units and/or buildings.
Shows the possible battle outcomes and their likelihood - from total defeat to flawless victory. One roll will be made to determine the outcome.
Master, you have conquered this settlement. Now, you can decide its fate!
Master, you have conquered this hamlet. Now, you can decide its fate!
Master, you have conquered this village. Now, you can decide its fate!
Master, you have conquered this town. Now, you can decide its fate!
Master, you have conquered this city. Now, you can decide its fate!
Master, you have conquered this outpost. Unfortunately, it was destroyed during the skirmish.
Towns cannot be built on water.
Unsuitable town site - tile is occupied by another location.
Unsuitable town site - there is an existing town within {0} tiles.
Are you sure you want to disband this unit?
Your spell has been countered by an existing enchantment.
Are you sure you wish to discard this spell? The Mana you have paid for it will be lost.
{0} has finished construction.\n{ICON:LMB} View town.\n{ICON:RMB} Dismiss.
You have finished summoning {0}.\n{ICON:LMB} View {0}.\n{ICON:RMB} Dismiss.
You have lost {0}.\n{ICON:LMB} Show town.\n{ICON:RMB} Dismiss.
One of your opponents tried attacking you with a spell but your protective enchantment has blocked the attempt.\n{ICON:RMB} Dismiss.
An opponent has cast a spell on {0}.\n{ICON:LMB} Show town.\n{ICON:RMB} Dismiss.
An opponent has cast a spell on one of your units.\n{ICON:LMB} Show unit.\n{ICON:RMB} Dismiss.
You can start research on a new spell.\n{ICON:LMB} Open Research.\n{ICON:RMB} Dismiss.
Outpost {0} has grown big enough to turn into a Hamlet. You can now manage its production.\n{ICON:LMB} View town.\n{ICON:RMB} Dismiss.
Your spell is ready.\n{ICON:LMB} Cast spell.\n{ICON:RMB} Dismiss.
Your artefact is ready.\n{ICON:LMB} View.\n{ICON:RMB} Dismiss.
Your {0} has leveled up.\n{ICON:LMB} View.\n{ICON:RMB} Dismiss.
Not enough Food is produced in {0} and its population is declining.\n{ICON:LMB} View.\n{ICON:RMB} Dismiss.
{0} has been raised from the dead and joins your army!\n{ICON:LMB} View.\n{ICON:RMB} Dismiss.
Construction queue in {0} is empty, this town will now build Housing.\n{ICON:LMB} View town.\n{ICON:RMB} Dismiss.
Are you sure you wish to sell this building for {ICON:GoldIcon}{0}?
If you sell this building it will cease the production of your {0}.

I welcome you, oh great {0}!
If you could spare a moment of your time for your lowly servant, I would like to present you with the world manipulators I prepared for your arrival.

(TURN ON TUTORIALS)
You can not sell this building because your {0} depends on it.
You can not sell this building because it is the result of an active enchantment.
Are you sure you wish to raze this town? It will cost {0} Fame.
Are you sure you wish to raze this outpost? Note that you will not regain the settler unit.
There were no unknown locations within the range of the spell.
This unit is not a valid target for the spell\n(The target could be immune to the type of spell cast or the effect is already present on the target).
Only one copy of this enchantment is permitted on the target.
There is no target available for this spell.
There is no wizard that you can target with this spell.
There are no units that can be brought back from dead with this spell.
There are no units that can be brought back from dead with this spell.
There are no units that can be affected by this spell.
This is not a valid location for this spell.
There is no target available for this spell or the selected location is invalid.
Construct an Outpost which turns into a Hamlet after several turns. A unit with Settler skill is required to perform this action.
Roads decrease ground movement costs and increase revenue in connected towns. A unit with Engineer skill is required to perform this action.
Attempt to gain control of the magic node. Your unit will be destroyed regardless of the melding being successful or not. A unit with Melder skill is required to perform this action.
Removes Corruption from this tile, returning it to its natural state. A unit with Purifier skill is required to perform this action.
Order this army to guard. They will not prompt you for further orders until you retract the guard order or an enemy appears in their range of sight.
Order this army to wait for orders until the next turn.
Allows to perform a special action (building an outpost, building a road, melding with a node or puryfing a corrupted tile), provided that the army contains a unit capable of such action.
Allows the army to travel to another plane, provided that it possess the relevant ability.
Your fortress is located in this city. If you lose it, you will be banished or defeated.
A segment of city wall is destroyed

Shows the Power production in this town.

Power is used to generate Mana, research spells and increase Casting Skill.

You can adjust how your Power is assigned for each purpose on the Magic screen.
Shows the Research production in this town.

Gold production of the town is derived mainly from taxes (therefore population growth will impact it).\n\nThe income can also be increased by trade goods, resources (minerals), buildings and some terrain types (shoreline and river).
This hero would like to join you in exchange for 100 {ICON:GoldIcon}
Thank you for freeing me, I will happily join your cause, if that is your wish?
Are you sure you want to delete this save file?
This book contains all spells that you have learned so far, oh Wise One.
It may be a lot of page flipping to find the spell you're looking for, but you can view spells from a specific domain, just use these bookmarks.
In order to cast a spell, first select it from the left page. If casting can be performed, you will see the Cast button here.
Some spells can only be cast while on the world map, others - only during combat. This is indicated here:
Casting requires magical energy called Mana {ICON:ManaIcon}. Each spell costs Mana to cast and some effects need Mana each turn for upkeep.

On the world map, casting time depends on your Casting Skill {ICON:CastingSkillIcon} - the higher the skill, the more Mana you can spend each turn. With a high enough skill, even some world spells can be cast instantly!
In combat, casting is always instant, but your Casting Skill limits how much Mana you can spend during the entire encounter.
Thank you, your magnificence! I will only take a moment.
Left click to select a unit or location.
Right click to move selected army on the map.
Each army will ask for orders every turn so if you want them to wait where they are, tell them to wait or guard.
Double click on your city to view it and manage its production.
Let's do that now, your Highness.
This area lets you assign your Power points, view enchantments and use Alchemy to turn Mana into Gold and vice versa.

These vials, your Greatness, show what proportion of your Power {ICON:PowerIcon} is used for each purpose - increasing your Mana reserve {ICON:ManaIcon}, researching spells {ICON:ResearchIcon} or improving your Casting Skill {ICON:CastingSkillIcon}.
You may always adjust these proportions by clicking on the vials. Clicking on the padlock will lock the value in place.
Both you and your rivals will likely cast various enchantments, affecting units, towns, the world and yourselves. You can view them here.
Most enchantments that you control cost you Mana each turn to upkeep, but you can cancel them with the {ICON:ButtonCancel} button.
If you have a surplus of Gold or Mana, Alchemy allows you to turn one into the other.
Your Excellence, as your advisor I feel obligated to point out that some of your towns are not defended.
Even in peaceful times there may be bandits roaming around. If another army marches into an undefended town, it is immediately lost!
Consider training a unit or summoning a magical creature to provide defence. Sometimes even a single unit, with the help of your powerful spells, can prevent a disaster.
Any newly found settlements are initially outposts and need some time to evolve to become a town. Until then, you cannot assign production orders.
How quickly an outpost becomes a town depends on terrain, nearby resources and a bit of luck - the progress is shown here.
It is wise to keep some defences - undefended towns are easy prey for bandits and rival Wizards!
I see you're considering a skirmish, Master - excellent! Let me tell you what to expect.
Your and your opponent's forces are shown here - you can view each unit's strength by hovering your wand over it.
Here, you can see the odds that I think you, oh Greatest One, have in this battle.
Consider your chances and decide what to do now - take command over your units personally, let me lead your forces (auto-combat) or do not engage.
Spells are an essential part of your fight for arcane supremacy - you are to become a Master of Magic, after all!
To expand your spell selection, you need to do research. The selection is limited to 8 spells but new ones will become available as you progress.
Remember, the Spell of Mastery is your final goal and it will only appear after you researched most of your other spells. Acquiring new Spellbooks will give you new spells to research.
Research takes time - how much, depends on the number of Research points {ICON:ResearchIcon} you produce and the spell's complexity. More powerful spells usually take longer.
Now, select a spell from the left page and you can see details on the right. Click the Research button to confirm. You will be notified when the work is complete.
This, your Excellence, is your glorious town. I will quickly show you around, if you allow.

Global Taxes and Unrest section lets you decide how high the taxes are for all towns. High taxes yield more Gold {ICON:GoldIcon}, but also more unrest {ICON:UnrestIcon}. Unhappy citizens turn into rebels and do not work.
This section shows all your towns, along with their current production, Gold {ICON:GoldIcon} they bring you, population {ICON:PopulationIcon} and unrest {ICON:UnrestIcon}.
Here you can find units that are currently stationed in this town. It's a good idea to keep some defenders. If your capital is conquered, you may lose it all!
The Citizens panel allows you to assign jobs to this town's population. Any non-rebelling citizen who is not a worker, will default to a farmer.
This section shows any resources in the town's catchment area. These resources provide various bonuses and are always good to have.
This panel shows you the construction queue of this town. Production speed depends on production points {ICON:ProductionIcon} generated by your citizens. You can also use Gold to speed things up.
This place allows you to set up a construction queue for this town - pick from either buildings (on the left) or units (on the right).
Hover your wand over a building or unit to learn more about its purpose or characteristics.
Click to add an item to the construction queue.
Greyed out buildings and units have prerequisites - they require other structures to be present in the town before you can construct them.
Are you sure you want to stop casting {0} and lose {1} invested Mana?
Walking allows unit to move on ground tiles
This unit is not permitted to move over water tiles.
Swimming allows units to move over water tiles.
This unit is not permitted to move over ground tiles.

Flying units ignore terrain movement costs and may not be attacked in melee unless the attacking unit is flying or possesses a Breath Attack, Gaze Attack, or Thrown Attack. Ground units may still retaliate to a flying unit when attacked.
Here you can view at a glance all towns that belong to you, my Master.
When you click on a town you can view its location in the world as well as any enchantments that affect it.
Any artefacts (magical items) you create, acquire from searching ruins or lairs, or purchase from merchants, are stored here, in your Fortress' vault.
They can be equipped by heroes (if you employ any), provided that they have an equipment slot matching the type of the item. Simply drag and drop an item onto a hero to equip.
Any items that you deem not useful to you, can be either destroyed to gain Mana, or traded with rival Wizards.
Here you can find detailed information about a particular unit.
Its statistics, hit points, movement, upkeep and other details are shown on the centre panel.
On the left you can check the unit's race, experience points, Spellbook (for casters) and equipped items (for heroes).
If you deem a unit's upkeep too expensive, you can disband it by pressing this button.
And finally, in this area you can see special skills of the unit as well as any enchantments that affect them.

This is a fantastic unit - one that has been summoned, created or transformed by magic. Fantastic units do not gain experience points, do not receive leadership bonuses from heroes and do not reduce unrest in towns like normal units do, but their attacks bypass other units' weapon immunity.
Here you can view all armies that serve under your banner, hired heroes and unused magical items.
Select an army to see where it is located in the world.
The Mirror shows the most important information about you, oh great Wizard.
Traits, which are your special abilities, are displayed here. New traits can sometimes be acquired as treasure from clearing out very difficult locations.
Your Spellbooks, which allow you to research and cast spells from their corresponding domains, are here. These too can be obtained from treasure.
If you'd like to know how your power compares to rival Wizards, click the History button. You can only see the power of Wizards you have already met.
The Victory section will show you your progress towards claiming the title of Master of Magic and thus - winning the game.
There is no target available for this spell. You will need to dismiss the spell or change it to another if a valid target does not become available by the end of this turn.
I see you have chosen to lead your troops personally, oh Great One. A few words of advice from me, if I may...?
Defending group is on the left and the attacking group is on the right. Defenders always go first and they win if they are not defeated within 50 turns.
During your turn, you can issue orders to units you control in any order. Each unit has a limited number of actions ({ICON:MovementIcon}) that is used for both movement and attack.

Wizards that participate in the battle can cast spells once per turn. You can do that too, provided you have enough Mana, spell power and the right spells, of course. Click this button to see your Spellbook.
Sometimes enemy forces can be too strong and it may be wise to retreat rather than face death. Be warned that escaping may also result in heavy losses.
If you need additional explanations about battle mechanics, look at the notes I've prepared for you.
Oh, almost forgot - if you'd like to get detailed information about any unit, click on it with {ICON:LMB}.\n\nGood luck, Master!
How many points you can spend on Spellbooks and Wizard traits.
How much Gold {ICON:GoldIcon} will you have at your disposal at the start of the game.

How well the computer-controlled players will make use of their available resources and how smart will they behave during battles.

Note that on Skilled level, the AI will be very aggressive and may require a lot of bribing not to go to war immediately.

On Master lvl the enemy Wizards will begin the game with very poor relations to you and will likely declare war almost immediately! You may attempt bribery, but War will still be inevitable sooner rather than later.
Strength and spawning frequency of neutral armies roaming the world.
Strength of neutral armies defending lairs.

Special events that occur in the world, ranging from an earthquake to a random gift. Choose from:
Old Original Unmodified - events like they were in the original game, with no player input.
Original Updated - modified to give the player choices in the events.
Original Updated and New events, created for the remake.
How much Power {ICON:PowerIcon} is gained for each controlled power node.
Set the maximum cost of movement over difficult terrain in battle.

Size of the Arcanus and Myrror planes.

Small planes - 1408 hexes
Medium planes - 2080 hexes
Large planes - 2880 hexes
You will begin your game with the selected hero in your army.

On easy setting you will begin the game with a granary, shrine and a settler in your capital.

On medium setting you start with a granary and a settler.

On hard setting you start with no extras.
How many computer-controlled opponents will you face during the game.
This town is using more Food than it is producing and its population is declining. Increase the Food production by assigning more people to farming or constructing buildings that produce Food.
I see you have already found the End Turn button, Your Grace.\nBut there are still a few useful manipulators I wanted to bring to your attention.
First, surveyor. This handy tool will tell you all about a tile you hover over. Press {ICON:Tab} to access it quickly.
You should also know how to switch your view between Arcanus and Myrror. Press {ICON:P} or use this button, just mind it will be a while before your units can freely travel between planes.
Your goal is to become the Master of Magic. To do that, you need to either eliminate rival Wizards or be the first to cast the Spell of Mastery.
If you need more details about a particular item, just hover your wand above it or press {ICON:RMB}.
Permanently removes this unit from your army.
Allows to assign artefacts to this character.
View spells that this character can cast.

Used for movement, attacks and casting spells.
Melee attack costs 50% of a unit's maximum {ICON:MovementIcon}.
Ranged attack costs 10 {ICON:MovementIcon} and casting a spell costs all of the remaining {ICON:MovementIcon}.

As long as the unit has at least 1 {ICON:MovementIcon}, it can perform an action.
Skip any remaining actions for all your units and end your turn.
Select the next unit that still has movement allowance left.
Order this army to carry on any previously planned movement.
Misfortune, Master! Hostile forces have conquered your capital and destroyed your fortress and summoning circle!
I can see you have already started casting the Spell of Return, which will build a new fortress in one of your remaining towns.
In case you do not control any towns, you have 10 turns to conquer one or you will be defeated.
If you need to generate Mana for the spell, use Alchemy, smash a magical item or try finding Mana crystals in loot.
Remember - until you have your fortress back, you are not able to cast any other spells and you no longer collect Power and Research from your nodes and buildings.
Best of luck, Master! Do not let this minor setback stop you on your way to victory!
{0} has started casting the Spell of Mastery!
You have started casting the Spell of Mastery!
Can be cast during your turn on the world map.
This type of spell can be cast during combat and its effect does not persist when the combat ends.
Summons a unit that will follow your orders. On the world map, the unit will appear at the Summoning Circle's location, while in combat - nearby allied units.

Enchantments are lasting effects applied either to a specific target, or the world. When cast from the world map, they usually require Mana for upkeep, when cast in combat, the upkeep is not required, but the effect ends after the battle is concluded.
Instant spells resolve their effects immediately and require no upkeep.

Mana {ICON:ManaIcon} cost to cast this spell. For spells that can be cast both from the world map and during combat, these costs are usually different, because battle spells' cost can be affected by the casting range {ICON:CastingRangeIcon} (the distance from the Wizard fortress).
Indicates who, or what is the spell usable on. Note: Occasionally, the target can have immunity to a particular spell type.

Shows how many turns it takes to complete casting of this spell. Casting time depends on your Casting Skill {ICON:CastingSkillIcon}, your current Mana{ICON:ManaIcon} reserves and the spell's complexity.

Amount of Mana {ICON:ManaIcon} per turn needed to sustain the summoned unit or enchantment (Wizard Traits such as Channeler and Conjurer may affect this).\nIf the cost cannot be paid, the unit is dissolved or the enchantment cancelled.
When the game ends, your score will be multiplied by this value.

A critical issue has been encountered. Further saves have been turned off to ensure previous, valid saves are not overriden. Try using F8 to send us a bug report if you like. Please restart the application before continuing (older saves will not work properly if you do not restart).

Use this form to report a problem with the game. A screenshot of the game, the latest save file and log will be attached to this report along with your comment and will be sent to our bug tracker. We do not collect any personal information.
Please describe your problem with as much detail as you can in the field below. If possible, include steps on how to reproduce, as these greatly improve the chance of being able to fix the problem.
Thank you for taking the time to write this report!
Magical energy used to cast spells.
Research and cast the Spell of Mastery
If you are running out of Gold {ICON:GoldIcon} but have a surplus of Mana {ICON:ManaIcon} (or vice versa), why not turn one into the other?
Gold and Mana are needed to upkeep your buildings and units, running out of either of them means losses.
Head over to your Magic panel and Transmute your surplus resource. It may not be a permanent solution, but will give you time to figure one out.
Number of research points required to complete this spell.
Number of turns it will take to research this spell, based on the number of research points you produce each turn.
Indicates how much Casting Skill will be used to cast this spell.
Are you sure you want to destroy {0}?\n\n{1} {ICON:ManaIcon} will be added to your Mana pool.
Master, we have found a power node! What are these, you ask?
Magic node is a place full of magical power. Whoever controls it, can tap into this Power and gain it for themselves.
Nodes come in three varieties: Nature, Chaos and Sorcery, and are always protected by magical creatures and spell barriers of their domain.
To conquer a neutral node, you first need to defeat its protectors and then perform a special action called melding.
Only two creatures can meld - Magic Spirit and Guardian Spirit. These can be summoned with the appropriate spell.
Be aware even a melded node can still be taken over by a rival Wizard's spirit.
Press F8 to report a bug
To use Earth Gate, each selected unit must have at least 1 movement point.
Instantly teleport units to another town on the same plane with Earth Gate enchantment for the cost of 1 movement point.

Misfortune, Master! Hostile forces have conquered your capital and destroyed your fortress and summoning circle!

I can see you have already started casting the Spell of Return, which will let you build a new fortress in one of your remaining towns.

In case you do not control any towns, you have 10 turns to conquer one or you will be defeated.

Until you have your fortress back, you are not able to generate Mana, perform research, increase your spell power or cast any other spells.

If you do not have enough Mana to complete the Spell of Return, use Alchemy, smash a magical item or try finding Mana crystals in lairs and ruins.

Best of luck, Master! Do not let this minor setback stop you on your way to victory.
You are banished and have lost all your towns! If you do fail to conquer or build another town before the time runs out, you will be defeated.
You can only cast spells once per round.
This unit has used up all of their Movement Allowance {ICON:MovementIcon} and cannot cast a spell until their next turn.
To cast a spell, click the Spellbook button at the bottom centre of the HUD. If your army has any spellcasting units, you will have the choice to select them here.
Casting spells during combat works a bit differently than on the overland map.

Standing next to an enemy unit allows you to perform a melee attack. Normally, during a melee attack, the defending unit performs a counter attack at the same time meaning that units deal damage to each other simultanously (It is possible that both the attacker and the defender units are eliminated!).

Each type of attack has a particular initiative. Special attacks (such as Thrown or Fire Breath), may have a different initiative and assign their additional damage before or after the regular melee damage is dealt. Damage from a special attack may eliminate the enemy unit before it is able to retaliate.

Flying units cannot be targeted with a walking or swimming unit's melee attack, unless the attacker possesses a certain special attack (Breath Attack, Thrown Attack or Gaze Attack). The melee unit, however, can perform a counter attack when attacked by a flying unit.

Units with Ranged Attack {ICON:RangedIconNormal} and available Ammunition {ICON:AmmoIcon} may perform a ranged attack on a target that is at least two tiles away. The target must be visible and not behind the Wall of Darkness. Ranged attacks do not provoke retaliation from the attacked unit.

Physical ranged attacks (such as missile {ICON:MissileIcon} or boulder {ICON:BoulderIcon}) become less effective with distance, suffering -10% Hit Chance {ICON:ToHitRangedBonusIcon} after each 3 tiles of distance.
Long range units, such as the Catapult or the Warship, suffer a maximum of -10% Hit Chance {ICON:ToHitRangedBonusIcon} due to distance.
Magical ranged attacks {ICON:LifeIcon} {ICON:DeathIcon} {ICON:NatureIcon} {ICON:ChaosIcon} {ICON:SorceryIcon} {ICON:TechIcon} do not suffer range penalties.
Most special attacks, such as Gaze Attacks or Breath Attacks, may not be delivered with a ranged attack. Touch Attacks will usually apply.
Movement Allowance {ICON:MovementIcon} is based on the unit's Movement Points on the overland map. In combat, it is used for both movement and attacking.

The cost of ground movement {ICON:MovementWalkingIcon} depends on the tile that the unit tries to enter. Some terrains have a movement cost higher than 1. It is possible to enter a tile costing more than the unit's remaining Movement Allowance {ICON:MovementIcon} if that movement depletes the unit's Movement Allowance.

Water movement {ICON:MovementSwimmingIcon} and flying movement {ICON:MovementFlyingIcon} always costs 1 point of Movement Allowance {ICON:MovementIcon}. Units that have solely water movement may not perform movement over land tiles.

The cost to initiate a melee attack is equal to half of the unit's maximum Movement Allowance {ICON:MovementIcon}, or any remaining Movement Allowance {ICON:MovementIcon} after moving the unit, whichever is greater. It is possible to perform two spearate melee attacks during the unit's turn, if that unit remains stationary. Units may also move before or after attacking.

The cost to perform a ranged attack is 10 Movement Allowance points {ICON:MovementIcon} or any remaining Movement Allowance points {ICON:MovementIcon}, whichever is greater. It is possible to move the unit and perform a ranged attack for the remainder of its Movement Allowance {ICON:MovementIcon}.
Armour {ICON:ArmourIconNormal} and Resistance {ICON:ResistanceIconNormal} are used to negate the effects of enemy's attacks.
Armour {ICON:ArmourIconNormal} works against melee and ranged attacks of all types but also against spells that hit and deal direct damage, such as a Fire Bolt.

Resistance {ICON:ResistanceIconNormal} works against enemy spells that affect the unit by applying lasting enchantments, such as Black Sleep. Depending on the spell or enchantment, a Resistance roll may be made once (upon being targeted), every turn (when trying to cancel the effect) or not at all.
You are banished and unable to cast any spells until you complete the Spell of Return.
You are victorious! You have proven yourself superior to all the Wizards.

You cast the ancient Spell of Mastery and thus banish any remaining rivals from your realms. The coveted title of Master of Magic is now unquestionably yours. May your magical reign be eternal and magnanimous.
You banished rival wizards from your realms. The coveted title of Master of Magic is now unquestionably yours. May your magical reign be eternal and magnanimous.
You cannot cast this spell because you do not have the Summoning Circle or the target is not a unit.
You cannot cast this spell because you do not have the Summoning Circle or the target is not a hero unit.
Gold is the universal language of trade.
The other party is interested in acquiring this item and is willing to pay a bit more for it.
The other party does not have a lot of interest in acquiring this item. They are still willing to buy it, but will pay less for it.
Your army will LOSE the battle and there will be NO survivors.
Your army will WIN the battle, but many units will be KILLED and the surviving ones will likely be heavily WOUNDED.
Your army will WIN the battle, but a number of units may be KILLED and the surviving ones will likely be WOUNDED.
Your army will WIN the battle, but some units will be WOUNDED and some may be KILLED.
Your army will WIN the battle, without losing any units, but some units might be lightly wounded.
Master, I am very sorry but the current game's data is corrupted and it cannot be saved.

Shows how much Mana can still be spent on casting spells this turn.\nIf a spell costs less than your maximum Casting Skill, it can be cast instantly, provided you have enough remaining Casting Skill and Mana.
Shows the number of turns remaining to complete this production task.\n\nNote: Housing and trade goods are ongoing projects of indefinite duration, and will persist until canceled.
Pay the indicated amount of Gold to reduce the production time to 1 turn.
This is the trade panel, where you can exchange various goods with rival Wizards or select them as offer during events.
These sections show the items that are available for trade, left side is yours, right side is the other Wizard's.
The centre sections show items currently selected for exchange or giveaway. Use your left mouse button to drag and drop items to place them in the offer section.
The value of each offer depends on the items but it is modified based on how interested the other party is in selling or acquiring the selected goods.
This interest is indicated by little green and red arrows shown next to the price.
The other party will agree to trade if your offer's value is equal or better than their offer's value.
Offering a better deal or giving gifts to the other Wizard will slightly increase their relationship with you.

Your familiar shall manage the town production.

They will build:
The strongest available defensive unit, if the current unit count is lower than 1 + townPop/5
Available Food producing building, if the town has more than 50% population as farmers
And economic (Food, production or Gold) buildings, as long as the population is lower than 5.
Then, any cheapest available building until the list is exhausted and defaults to housing.

You may change/add your own choices and the familiar will prioritise them.
You have no battle spells in your spellbook.
Shows the current and maximum number of units in the army.\n\nWhen the army is full, no other units can join it but it will still be possible to summon or take over enemy units during combat.
Uncommon spells are not available because your Wizard does not have enough spellbooks in this realm.\n\nTo select from uncommon spells you need at least 10 spellbooks.
Rare Spells are not available because your Wizard does not have enough spellbooks in this realm.\n\nTo select from rare spells you need at least 11 spellbooks.
May hold a sword, an axe or a mace.
May hold a sword, an axe, a mace, a bow or a crossbow.
May hold a staff or a wand.
May hold a sword, an axe, a mace, a staff or a wand.
May hold a shield, a chainmail or a platemail.
May hold jewellery, a cloak, a helm, a gauntlet or an orb.
Your Summoning Circle has been moved to {0} because {1} has been conquered or destroyed.\n{ICON:LMB} Show town.\n{ICON:RMB} Dismiss.
Your Greatness,\n\nIf you manage to complete casting this spell, you will be victorious! But be aware that other wizards know this and will do whatever is in their power to stop you.
Your Greatness,\n\nIf {0} casts this spell, they will be victorious and all other wizards will be eliminated! Do whatever you can to stop that wizard, before it is too late!

Master,\n\nOne of your opponents has lost their Fortress and are now banished. They must cast the Spell of Return and before they do, they are not able to cast anything else. Perhaps you could use their vulnerability to your advantage?
Hint: Your units can get killed or wounded when retreating from a battle with a stronger enemy.
Hint: Rebels do not contribute to their town's production but will still require food.
Hint: If you're short on gold, but have plenty of mana (or vice versa) - use Alchemy to turn one into the other.
Hint: Some units can be immune to certain types of attacks or magic - check their stats for details.
Hint: Magic nodes give powerful enchantments to fantastic units of a node's type (including those controlled by you!).
Hint: Magic nodes try to dispel all spells you cast unless they belong to that node's domain.
Hint: When you're not able to pay unit upkeep because of gold, mana or food shortages, your units will abandon you.
Hint: Flying units cannot be targeted with normal melee attacks unless the attacker is flying or possesses a Breath Attack, Gaze Attack, or Thrown Attack.
Hint: Other Wizards will immediately go to war with anyone who begins casting the Spell of Mastery, no matter how friendly their relations were before.
Hint: Be careful when moving your units nearby towns belonging to other Wizards. Such actions will worsen your relations and may eventually lead to war.
Hint: Remember that if things go wrong, you can cast the Rewind Time spell (also known as Load the Game spell).
Hint: Each town has a range of 2 hexes and this does not change throughout the game. Settle where you can gain the most.
Hint: Most units (except those belonging to Death realm) can heal naturally and regain 5% of Hit Points per turn, even when moving.
Hint: Losing your capital city is a serious blow, keep it well defended.
Hint: Your fortress in the capital can shoot magical bolts at attacking enemies, the bolts' power depend on the number and type of your spellbooks.
Hint: Conquering a magic node is only the first step - send a Magic Spirit or a Guardian Spirit to meld with it so you can tap into the node's power.
Hint: One of the ways to reduce unrest in towns is to keep non-fantastic units in the town's garrison.
Hint: Some terrain's special resources can be changed into others with the Transmute spell.
Hint: You can have up to 6 heroes. You can dismiss any one you don't like and wait for a new offer or cast one of the hero summoning spells to get a new one.
Hint: During battle, terrain type does NOT impact a unit's defense, chance to hit or visibility.
Hint: Invisible units can only be attacked by units standing right next to them.
Hint: Fantastic units don't gain experience or reduce unrest in towns they are located in.
Hint: At the start of combat you will always have your full casting skill, no matter what you have cast before in this turn.

Note - the import/export tools are not suitable for copying modules to give to other players as the output files do not contain all event data, just text.

Please select which form of export you would like to use:

Single Mode - exports only the currently selected module while keeping text structure.

Bundle Mode - all toggled modules are exported as one BundleBlock prepared for localisation.

Note - the import/export tools are not suitable for copying modules to give to other players as the output files do not contain all event data, just text.

Please select which form of import you would like to use:

Single Mode - import text only for the currently selected module.

Bundle Mode - import text from BundleBlock file.
to our dedicated MuHa supporters as well as the great Master of Magic fans who have welcomed us into their midst,
also to each and every participant in the Beta tests and all the people who provided invaluable input and suggestions to help us improve this game. We love you all!

Toggles the faster loading mode, which decreases loading times for existing games. Please note that this is an experimental feature and uses a lot of hard drive space!

Enable or disable the additional content added with various free updates.
The free addons may include various additional content, like extra setting options or even free Wizards.

Some of the content includes:

-Population growth settings.
-Increasing distance needed to build towns.

Restart Required.\nYou have changed the mods settings.\nYou must restart the game for the changes to take effect.

Allow additional Tech dungeons to appear during mid-game. These dungeons will produce roaming Soultrapped armies that will pose additional danger. They are more aggressive than typical roaming units and will seek out strongest Wizards.

Reduced Intensity - spawns a few Tech Dungeons during late-game (turn 300).

Normal Intensity - spawns a few Tech Dungeons during mid-game (turn 250).

Increased Intensity - spawns many Tech Dungeons during early mid-game (turn 150).

Maximum Intensity - spawns many Tech Dungeons during early game (turn 100).

This option reduces the required casting skill points for increasing the Casting Skill. So, a 10% reduction will reduce the cost from 100 to 90 and so on.

Shows how happy the other wizard is with this trade. If your offer's value is lower than theirs, they may still accept the trade but your relationship will worsen. Likewise, your relationship will improve if your offer's value is higher than theirs.\nThe other wizard's likeliness of accepting an unfavorable deal is based on their relationship with you and their fear of you. Happiness from a trade offer is determined by the other wizard's economical status and research advancement.
